qas.question: What did the World Economic Forum's Global Competetiveness Report Rank Switzerland's economy as?

answers.text: the most competitive in the world

qas.question: What was the gross median estimate of household income in Switzerland in 2007?
What was Switzerland's median income in 2007?
How did the European Union rank Switzerland's economy?

context: The World Economic Forum's Global Competitiveness Report currently ranks Switzerland's economy as <a0_0>the most competitive in the world<a0_0/>, while ranked by the European Union as <a3_0>Europe's most innovative country<a3_0/>. For much of the 20th century, Switzerland was the wealthiest country in Europe by a considerable margin (by GDP – per capita). In 2007 the gross median household income in Switzerland was an estimated <a1_0>137,094 USD at Purchasing power parity<a1_0/> while the median income was <a2_0>95,824 USD<a2_0/>. Switzerland also has one of the world's largest account balances as a percentage of GDP.
